title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with generic questions, fairly straightforward process involving multiple levels of managers (immediate report and above). Nothing much to say beyond that since the questions and format of these interviews is pretty similar for assistant positions across libraries.
Interview Questions: I don't remember the specific questions, nothing unusual for the field

title: Museum Educator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: It was not hard. The questions are easy to answer. The interviewers are also caring and friendly that they really want to help you to learn and reach your goal
Interview Questions: What do you know about California art?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth, relax and casual was able to have great conversation with interviewer. Ensure to be your authentic self. Be prepared to answer a lot of situational questions. Took a month to respond back to me with my acceptance.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to attend Uci For grad school?

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: This was a very Standard Thirty Minute Interview with Three Person Panel on site in person. Approximately fifteen minutes of questions followed by a skill test and any of your questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Tutorial Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Formal interview showing demonstration of tutoring specific subject. interview with two people, usually ask about experience with specific subject and why you liked about that course, mine was for math2b(calculus)
Interview Questions: How would you explain to me without using specific terms how to draw a bike?

title: Ruby On Rails Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, a week later I got an email from the recruiter. We then talked on the phone and he asked me what I did at my previous job. Then they scheduled an interview the following week. The interviewer was a senior developer. He asked me basic questions about software development. This was not a technical interview. Then they scheduled me for a technical interview. During the interview, I was given 45 minutes to solve a problem. I was able to solve it and get the desired output. I had 2 interviewers one of whom was the same person who interviewed me before. They then asked me questions about my code like how it worked and how I would have coded it if I had more time. Then they asked me other basic questions about programming in general. 2 weeks later I had a "meet the team" interview with 8 other people. Each person asked me a question or two about how I would react to different situations. I felt optimistic because I passed the technical interview and the meet the team interview went well. However, the next week I was informed they chose another candidate. I was disappointed.
Interview Questions: During the technical interview I was asked to read from a CSV file. The data from the CSV file had to be processed and filtered and written to another CSV file. I was given 45 minutes to complete the task. I was allowed to google search. I was able to finish it and get the desired output. Other questions: 1) Have you worked in an agile environment and describe the process 2) What is the biggest challenge you have ever had? 3) If you have a conflict with one person, how would you deal with it? 4) What is your way of writing bug free code?

title: Aerodynamics Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: First you submit your resume, and later they will contact you via email to fill in the interview time slot. It was through a zoom call, and they asked both technical and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What are the four forces that act on an airplane?

title: Esports Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Asked a lot of scenarios - did not ask much about prior qualifications. Was interviewed in a group of two at a time. Was given ample time to think of responses and in a group setting, was more comfortable during the interview and the interviewer was extremely easygoing.
Interview Questions: Describe a scenario where you were in the middle of conflict and you were able to settle it.

title: Photographer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward and went through a few rounds. I was sat in a room with a group of three interviewers and went through the regular process of the interview. The interview lasted about half an hour.
Interview Questions: What do you think we can improve on for photo organization and workflow?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straight forward, there were no trick questions. They provided a clear expectation of what the process was going to be. There was clarification about some of the responsibilities and I asked if there was flexibility on any of them and/or if there were any deal breakers so that we wouldn't waste any time for the rest of the interview process.
Interview Questions: Where do you expect to see yourself in three to five years?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the position online and got a 30 min video interview with the current project coordinator in the lab about 3 weeks after the application.  That was the only interview in the whole process
Interview Questions: What are your three biggest strengths and why

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: It was a typical zoom interview process with the usual questions you would expect and it was clear that they really did care about what you had to say and had great feedback/reactions.
Interview Questions: Why UCI over other schools you applied to?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: people are kind, professional about describing the position and my interested topic during the interview. But I never got to move forward with the position even though I applied to mutliple position already.
Interview Questions: talk me through your resume

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Challenging but productive and thought provoking as the position straddled that of an administrator and academic. It entailed a committee of five panelists lead by the director. It was for a new position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: I found the job on Handshake and applied. I received a message asking if I was interested in coming in for an interview which I accepted. The interview was in person held on campus.
Interview Questions: Are you able to create posters based on verbal instructions?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very odd. Asked fewer behavioral questions and more specific questions about the position.  The main interviewer also did not mention that I would be interviewed by a panel of 4-5 people. It was hard to be personable since the main interviewer didn't seem like they wanted to be there.  They also had an activity at the end on prioritization and you had to explain why you chose what you chose. I thought it would be easier since this is a student position.
Interview Questions: If you could teach one class, which would it be?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: I did zoom video meeting with 2 people. They were okey. Interview process was alright. I just didn't made it to the end. I think it would be good place to work.
Interview Questions: What is your strength related to your skill

title: Clinical Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone interview then I went to an in person interview. I was not contacted for weeks afterwards, despite sending a thank you email and expression of continued interest.
Interview Questions: They asked about my past experience with medicine.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Was a straightforward interview, asking about background in the field, as well as what drives me to study the specific subject. Interviewer was very amiable, did not feel super formal and thus was much easier to relax
Interview Questions: What led you to choose this program?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very good and about 30 minutes in length. The interviewer was nice and explained  everything thoroughly. The questions were average, so make sure to prepare beforehand.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell me about yourself

title: Student Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people. I had to take an in person coding interview and then explain my code. Also had some extra whiteboard problems. Overall very good experience and I recommend applying here
Interview Questions: Regular leet code questions easy-medium

title: AV Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, around a month later I got a call from their HR, 1 week after I got another call to setup an interview for 2 weeks from then. It was a 3 panel interview from their "OIT" department. Everyone was very friendly, concise, and wanted to know more about who I was and the role I play with my past work. Only some questions were actually pertinent to the role.
Interview Questions: A few questions were about work projects I have worked on and personal projects that I have been a part of and how I lead the operations of them.

title: Summer Research Student Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: basic zoom interview, a few days advance notice will be given, approximately 20 minutes. I haven't received an offer yet, the interviewer was very nice. The interview questions are very basic, it's some behavioral interview content, just prepare well.
Interview Questions: tell me a bit about yourself

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Very brief interview, took less than 20 minutes. Fast decision. Interviewers are relaxed and want to know what brings you to the job rather than why you are not fit for the role.
Interview Questions: What makes you different from the other applicants

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Interview was on-site, in one of their meeting offices. It was with 5 panel members including the upper-management of the IT team,  and asked a mix of questions about past experiences and behavioral-type questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us a bit about yourself.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions:
Remote call with one of the faculties you chose in your SOP.
I had received a positive sign from my future advisor, by telling me to visit the visiting day to feel the nice weather of California.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself and your research interest.
Tell me about the project (I've written on my SOP)

title: Admitting Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was about 25 questions, mostly about background and avaliable work schedule. Several questions regarding qualifications and goals to achieve. Several questions about meeting the required skill set. One question about required salary range. Many statements about job benefits such as health coverage and retirement options.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you think you qualify for this position?

title: Sports Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: In a group setting. The interviewers asked questions about how to handle high stress situations and give examples. They ask you to give ideas of what can be improved with sports at UCI.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: smooth process and professional. workers there are serious about the job which is how you take it. overall positive experience and would recommend to others who may decide to come here
Interview Questions: What would you do first if the phone rang, a customer approached you, and someone in the back needs computer help?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied and received email for first round interviews, conducted interview over zoom the following week, did not hear back for almost a month that I was not moving forward.  Requested before zoom interview access to questions for reading and comprehension, was not given "because it wasn't an option for others" even though I asked as an accommodation request.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you're interested in the position?

title: Housing Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (UCI, CA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Notified through email. Schedule interview online. Sit in a room with 3 interviewers at Anborn, 2nd Floor of the Middle Earth Towers. Introduce self and pronouns before starting. The 3 interviewers were patient and welcoming, but serious about the interview.
Interview Questions:
1. Gives paper with situation. Have you rank which tasks to finish in order and give reason.
2. What would you do if there was a penguin in your fridge?
3. How would you handle working with a co-worker you don't get along with?
4. Define professionalism.
5. How will you manage your time?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Several rounds with lots of people. Started with a phone screen then a group interview. Included a final presentation and final meeting with senior executives. There was a broad range of questions. Knowledge of higher ed was key.
Interview Questions: How does your past experience relate to this position.

title: Operations Crew Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly quick, managing to only be around 15-20 minutes. They had the expected questions of "What do you think you will get out of this job" and such.
Interview Questions: What do you want to get out of this job?

title: Project Policy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The virtual interview consisted of three different departmental people, and they gave a lot of information about many different aspects of the project, however it it was confusing and not at all clear what the job duties were.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Name a time in which you resolved a conflict.

title: Dining Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: It was conducted over a quick phone interview and it was pretty short. I got the interview over the UCI class facebook page. However, it's possible to get an application by just asking at the front of either of the dining halls.

title: Resident Advisor (RA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer asked some personal questions, what you like to do in your free time, why the position fits. The interviewer also asked for examples of handling social situations. Also asked about prior work experiences.
Interview Questions: What do you enjoy doing with your freetime?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a smooth process. My first step was a 15-20 minute phone screening. About 2-3 days later I was contacted for a panel interview via zoom. I received email notification about 3 weeks later advising they were moving forward with other candidates for round 3 of the interview process
Interview Questions: Explain your experience scheduling/coordinating travel arrangements for your leadership team

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: It's good with the professors. They are kind and would like to answer questions. Need to do some research before going for the interview. They don't push you answer questions. Overall experience is good.
Interview Questions: What do you think about a certain paper.

title: Master Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: First, like any other application we have to apply online and then if we got approved after they check out  our applications records, we will be invited for the first zoom interview.
Interview Questions: what was the most challenging time that you had in your last job? and how you solve that?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard. Only one person interviewed me. The interview was about an hour long conducted over skype. The interview process shouldn't be stressed about. Overall, fast interview timeline and easy questions.
Interview Questions: describe a situation when you ran into an issue, where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Financial Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: There are four people in the interview, included accounting manager, accountant, HR, and senior financial analyst. They took turns to ask questions. And will ask more detail if any one is interested.

title: Helper Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: It was cool. Easy interview I don't know why we are forced to write these. How much longer am I supposed to write. Even more still wow, Okay well I guess I have to write an essay.
Interview Questions: Trying to get through requirement how much am i supposed to write?

title: Grad Program Candidate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The faculty is really kind and patient. They illustrate the details very clear. The curriculum of the MsBA is very practical and useful. All the professors are kowning their topic
Interview Questions: Why do you aant to study this subject

title: Conversation Partner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine

The interviewer would ask questions and we would answer in a designated order. most questions were hypothetical so It required a lot of quick thinking and improvisation. The interviewer was looking to see how seemed the most outgoing and friendly.
Interview Questions: what would you do on a typical day with your group?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: basic zoom interview, about 5 or 6 questions and one question to ask interviewer. they will send a email to you before the interview. do some research about your program and good luck
Interview Questions: introduce yourself and highlight things you're proud of

title: Peer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very casual zoom call interview.  Asked particular study strategies and ways I would be able to help students struggling in their coursework and how to succeed in the future.  Approximately 15-20 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Q: What advice would you give a student who was struggling to succeed in a particular course?

title: Food Services Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The interview went smoothly: questions were fair, staff was professional, and building was easy to find. I had a good experience. I would recommend this employer. That is all. I am writing this because Glassdoor won't allow me to view content otherwise.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, your passions, and experience.

title: Student Affairs Officer III Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Questions regarding student cases, organization, and problem-solving. There were about 10 questions (some were long) and there was a chance to ask your own questions at the end. Make sure that you have questions to ask about their department/office to show you did your research on the school and student population.
Interview Questions:
Student scenarios where they are upset. 
Student scenario where you have to decide what takes priority.

title: OIT Student Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds of interviews, all over zoom. Did an easy coding question. Was asked multiple questions about personal goals, past experiences, etc. Interviewers were always respectful. Did not get an offer.
Interview Questions: Talk about a previous leadership experience

title: IT General Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The network administration team, around 5 or so people, take turns to ask questions. They were pretty general questions for the most part, and everyone was pleasant. The interview was not extremely long, and there was only one application and one interview, and I received my acceptance notification quickly.
Interview Questions: What is most important to you when it comes to customer services?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Asked about your experiences dealing with others. In addition, my background of what I know and how I am qualified for the job is also asked.  There were 3 interviewers each asking a couple questions about my qualifications and such.
Interview Questions: How have I dealt with language barriers in the past?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. After a couple of weeks of waiting. Received email scheduling interview. Interview was scheduled and call was made. Was told that application will be sent to hiring department and will receive a response back later.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UCI?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The process was short but does require basic understanding of computer science. This including self-introduction and a couple of coding questions. Those questions are similar to the ones on leetcode. So brush up your algorithms there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this company

title: Project Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions:
It was a quick, smooth interveiw. Questions were direct to the point. 
Invited to visit the campus and the lab, and talk to people to learn about the environment. Very straightforward hiring process
Interview Questions: How's your research experience relevant to what we do here?

title: General Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward. They asked the typical questions and how well you handle the job such as your computer skills, you interpersonal skills and your public speaking skills. After that they asked about your strength and weaknesses and how well you do under pressure.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths and weaknesses

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, phone interview with peer who asked questions that were more from a BSA certificate exam , 2 hour 4 person panel with hiring manager and peers, final interview with director.
Interview Questions: The questions were very canned and straight from the internet. None of them were seriously thought out questions. The team seemed more concerned on if I knew the exact terminology and definitions of the deliverable documents a BSA is responsible for. An example: What is the difference between a functional and non-functional requirement?  Seriously!  They should be asking questions about the persons background and situational questions.

title: Quality Assurance and User Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview with manager, team member and another manager. The people were very nice and the there was nothing unusual or remarkable about the interview. Typical job interview that I had fully prepared for.
I felt I performed well and the job matched well with my background and experience. I don't think any of that mattered. During my questions to them, I was able to ascertain that there was at least one internal candidate being considered. I got a strong feeling that they were just going through the motions with me and were planning to hire the internal candidate. This is typical with government and pseudo-government positions where there seems to be a lot of nepotism.
Interview Questions: They gave me a list of job-related obligations that I might hypothetically face and asked me to rank them as to the order I would perform the tasks and/or how I would address them.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Submit the application online. The HR personnel from the department will make a phone interview to go over the questions. HR personnel will record the interview and report to HR manager for further process.
Interview Questions: Explain your experience related to the applied job.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was over the phone and lasted about 15-20 minutes. The interviewer introduced himself and what the job entails, and I was asked 3-5 questions by the interviewer.
Interview Questions: How did you mange a stressful work situation? Can you elaborate on your leadership experiences?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was not lengthy, but had to go through two interviews. First one was with 3 people, and questions were general interview questions, second interview was with 2 people, and questions were more about the kind of goals I had and what I could bring to the table. The people who interviewed me were very kind, and I also felt they showed genuine interest in my application.
Interview Questions: How will this job help you reach your future goals?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Only be interviewed once by the PI, not so formal for this position. If the PI think you are a good fit, that is pretty easy. No reference letter required.
Interview Questions: What techniques do you grasp

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: medium nice then asked some questions explaining my goals and experience. what i can bring to the table. so gdluck youll be fine its not so stressful . thanks for reading thus far
Interview Questions: many questions

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was not as bad as I thought, depending on the interview, it can be solo or in a group. The interviewers were polite and professional, nothing rude or intimidating.
Interview Questions: What is your time availability for the next school year?

title: General Assistant, DCE Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of 2 rounds. The first was more of case-study questions regarding work behavior and ethics, for instance how you interact in a team environment. The second interview is more so on practical experiences and application.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar working with HTML?

title: Post-Baccalaureate Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (UCI, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Online through Zoom because of the Covid-19 pandemic. Between the recruiting director and another person, the questions were very average and meant to assess on a basic level. However, it was very respectable and mutual on how competitive it was to get into this program
Interview Questions: How does the program fit into your greater goals?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: I applied at the job fair. I think it was about 2 weeks later that I received a call over the phone. They asked if I had some spare time and we had a phone interview first, then I was invited to a group interview. There they explained more about what they did and asked some basic questions. They seem to hire based on your phone voice, ability to make rapport, and your creativity.
Interview Questions: Sell me this item.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted a few days later for a group skype interview. There was about 5 people in my interview. I was hired a couple days after a salary negotiation.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience.

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: First interview was over the phone. If that goes well, then you are invited to a group interview. They ask you a few questions about your personality, ask you to pitch an item to sell, and ask you to talk on the phone so they can analyze your phone voice.
Interview Questions: Be as creative as you can and sell me this item

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward, well organized, and with several different individuals. The schedule was sent in advance and was followed. Getting from parking to the office was pretty straightforward. One person was a well-trained interviewer, two people were just okay, but pleasant.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What will you contribute to our organization? Tell me about a difficult colleague you have worked with.

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty straight forward, I was asked about my previous experience. Application was a bit longer and required 3-5 letters of rec. Processing took a while to actually get hired though.
Interview Questions: Please describe your previous experience.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was very awkward. The hiring manager would talk poorly about my current company and was rude to his fellow leadership. The also mentioned how I would be on a probation period and emphasize "I have no problem firing people". I got bad vibes and declined to move forward in the hiring process.
Interview Questions: Experiences/duties on my current job

title: IT Student Interview

Interview Descriptions:
I was offered to come into the office and interview for the position and was asked a few questions about my experience with computers.

Have you worked with computers before? How would you rate your computer hardware skills?

title: Director Interview

Interview Descriptions: Was reached out to by HR about a week or two after submitting my online application; process was a 30-minute phone interview with HR followed by a panel interview and a presentation

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions:
1. Contacted a future advisor by explaining why I am a correct person who can support to his/her research.
2.  Applied on website
3. Interviewed with the professor in-person
4. Receive the admission in 3 months

title: Internal Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Two staffs interview. One round. They will ask you about 10 to 15 questions. The questions were asked one by one. Took about 30 minutes. The mood of the interview is easy-going.
