title: GSR Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: I contacted an advisor at UCI and we scheduled an Skype interview when I presented my MS thesis and explained about my background and previous experiences. Then they explained about the open position and current projects and asked a few technical questions to assess my base knowledge.
Interview Questions: I explained my MS thesis.

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: the 1st round interviewed with the hiring manager, who is very nice and talked about the daily responsibilities of the job. the 2nd round interview with the senior manager, felt that did not  answer some of his questions well.
Interview Questions: could you tell something about yourself.

title: Cashier/Food Server Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick. 10 min top. The manager pulled me aside to one of the lunch table. We sat opposite each other. I was lucky to meet her right away. I interviewed at some other places in the food courts and the managers were not in.
Interview Questions: Do you mind cleaning the trash?

title: Student Venture Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Going to events at the ANTrepreneur Center helped me meet the people working there and build friendships. Once I met the people at the center and demonstrated past experience alongside the ability to ask good questions, I was brought into the team.
Interview Questions: Have you been a consultant before?

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quick zoom interview with president, and corresponding position directors. Asked a few basic questions then questions specifically pertaining to position. Depending on how many positions applied to, it lasted around 25 minutes.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: advisors ask you about your previous research. You have to provide them the list of your papers and be ready to briefly talk about your contribution in any of those papers. One hour presentation is necessary.
Interview Questions: How did you find about my projects?

title: Master of Science Biotechnology Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
1-hour Skype interview 
Background
Why are you interested in the program 
What are some positive and negative experiences you've had working in a team
What are you hoping to do in your future career, after the program
Interview Questions:
Background
Why are you interested in the program 
What are some positive and negative experiences you've had working in a team

title: Lab Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Quick behavioral questionnaire. The questionnaire asked for my availability, proficiency in languages, and experience teaching others. After filling out the questionnaire, the CS student council decided my fate. The questions were quite reasonable. Not at all hard to answer.
Interview Questions: What do you think makes you a good tutor?

title: Marketing & Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewing with the department was great and they were lovely people, but I was most frustrated with the recruiter who set up the interview. 

She forgot so many things: the directions, the map, and most importantly she got the interview date mixed up! I was horrified when I received a phone call from the interview panel asking where I was. She scheduled me for a Thursday when her email reflected that I was scheduled on a Friday.

I rushed to my interview and got there 30 minutes later than my original time slot. I strongly feel that the mix-up on the interview dates and my showing up late impacted their impression of me and also their hiring decision.

I never received a follow-up email, even when I reached out to my recruiter. Phone calls were ignored too and I haven't heard back from this day.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working on different projects?

title: Finance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was informal and easy going with a structure list of questions.  the interview was not stressful with only 2 people in the interview.  It was an easy interview and lasted about 40 minutes long with conversation and tour of the building and work stations and other employees.
Interview Questions: What type of animal would you be if you were an animal?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Just talked to professors in the video once, then got the offer. The professor may care a lot of the research background and the attitude. They gave me the offer about 2 weeks after the interview
Interview Questions: Opinions to make the project possible.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Nice staff. Very casual interview but sometimes they usually accept work study students who apply. 
Most of assistants they are currently enrolling at school. So maybe your coworkers can be your peer student all the time.
Interview Questions: Why you are interested in this job?

title: Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions:
Professional and courteous. Knew exactly what to expect in the questioning. Interviewer did not hide the ball, was straight forward on expectations for the position.

Initial interview was a call, then in-person interview. All questions were answered and the hiring decision process was average for the position.
Interview Questions: Background, experience and hypotheticals questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly standard. I met with the lab manager and a few of the team members, the PI was not there, but I expected this. They showed me around the lab, talked about day to day operations then we sat down and I answered a few questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 to 10 years

title: Labratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Through asking some of the professors on campus i knew, they sent me to a project head who was looking for undergraduate assistants. Since most of my credentials were based on my grades in the classes i took, the interview was only on a personal basis to see if i would be a good fit with the others in the lab, and my availability to work.
Interview Questions: What days and times are you open to work? Have you gotten through X and Y in you electricity and magnetism class? We will using those extensively so let me know if you are not totally comfortable. We need you to learn how to create a Monte Carlo simulation in python. Can you do this?

title: Housing Programmers Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: There are some questions about personal experience in the beginning, they will ask your experience in certain housing community and how do you think about their program. Some behavior questions ask me how to handle residents' problem or how to interact with co-workers. At the end, they ask if I have anything to tell them, any advice to the program.
Interview Questions: If students coming to ask you about the academics problem they met,  how would you response

title: Graduate Division Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was brief and concise. They were able to get straight to meeting who you are as a person and what you plan to contribute. They asked a few questions regarding organization and punctuality with deadlines and the expectations they had with overall job performance. It was a good interview and very easy-going.
Interview Questions: How do you maintain organization?

title: Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a resume and cover letter, about 2 weeks later was called in for a first interview, called later that day for a second interview. The last interview was about 2 weeks ago and haven't heard from them regarding the position and whether it was filled.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with the complications involved in video production?

title: Assistant Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I did not have an interview it was an internal posting. Easy paperwork to fill out. Overall an easy job to apply for with minimal barriers. HR staff is friendly.
Interview Questions: They asked about GPA, highest degree

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Well organized, questions were pertinent and expected. HR managers were nice but succinct. They didn't mince words and I appreciated that. Applicants can expect tough questions but as long as you're thoughtful and genuine you'll do great!
Interview Questions: Describe strengths, weakness, time you went above and beyond for a patient. The questions were easy but they were looking for competent and clear answers

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The Private investigator asked about my availability, also asked about activities from my resume. Then I interviewed with the lab manager, and I was asked if I am able to adapt to the environment,  and if I am willing to work over time.
Interview Questions: What is western blot?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fantastic and very detailed.  Interviewer took time time to explain job description, benefits and the salary.  I would rate the interviewer as very good and knowledgeable.  I was shown the facilities where I would be working.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied after 2 month, then got a email for phone interview. The interview was very short and they let you know whether you get the job after a couple days.
Interview Questions: Experience with laboratory.

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: There was no formal interview, just a series of casual chats, because I'd been a GSA for the same program and they had known me for years. I don't think they have hired anyone who is NOT a former GSA for years--there is such a huge pool of overqualified, underemployed PhDs and no jobs for them.
Interview Questions: Ideas for future course themes

title: GA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Was student applying for UCI Division of Continuing Education for a part time position. Apply online and get interview.. was easy and fast to do..hiring process was quick and they were responsive
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Conversation Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was straight forward.  Questions were simple. The hiring manager/program manager of the position was very sweet, and it was lovely to chat with her. 
The hiring process was the usual HR paperwork, even though the position consisted of less than 10 hours per week.
Interview Questions: How would you help international students integrate to UCI campus?

title: Telephone Outreach Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was straight forward and they asked questions revolving the job. Nothing out of left field. They scheduled all the interviews on the same day, which was nice so I didn’t have to travel back and fourth multiple days.
Interview Questions: Take me through the process of segmenting and creating calling pools?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview followed by on site interview.  There is one to one meeting with lab member and with Professor.  The experience was great!!They showed me the facility in the lab.
Interview Questions: Question from presentation were asked

title: Mesa Court Center Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied as a freshman during their Fall hiring season. They hire most of the team before the summer and then hire 10 or so more people in the fall. 
I was then interviewed by 2 of the student managers.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a situation where you are in conflict with another center attendant?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Talk about experience and skills, then ask about what the possible challenges will be and introduce the overall duty and opportunity of the job, discuss over the general benefit and possible risk
Interview Questions: What relevant experience do you have previously?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter contacted me via LinkedIn.  He scheduled a phone screen 2 weeks out on a Saturday and forgot to calendar it,  missing the call. He reaches out, I immediately call back and he doesn't return calls. Spent process chasing him down for follow up. After 6 weeks, resume has just now landed with hiring committee. Recruiter was to follow up with a link and yet again failed to send.
Interview Questions: What are you doing now that you are no longer employed?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The environment was very pleasant, and the staff was very aware and willing to work with students' schedules. I went into the office, and was asked why I was interested in the position and when I would be available to work.
Interview Questions: What was my class schedule like?

title: Assistant Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was not a formal interview process. The PI offered the position to help my career transition and finish a collaborative project. I have been working with the PI for several years.
Interview Questions: Would you like to extend another three months to finish writing the paper and consulting for several projects?

title: General Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC Irvine in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the program coordinator, an academic counselor, and senior general assistant. Was asked some behavioral questions and typical interview questions. After the interview, I had to take an assessment test after for detail-orientedness.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: After applying for the job, I heard back a few weeks later via phone call. When I answered the phone, they conducted an impromptu phone interview. The person on the phone made the entire hiring process very clear, telling me all the requirements and steps before conducting the interview. Then, we scheduled an in person interview for the following day, which was followed by an assessment test
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Data Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a cover letter on job website. And few days later, scheduled for an interview. Was asked about the projects I did. Few days later, I got a call for the offer.
Interview Questions: How do you solve conflicts? How do tackle a problem?

title: Office Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Applied on their website. If they are interested in you, most communication is done by email. Received email asking if I was still interested in the position and a date was set to come in to meet with the department managers. Parking at the campus was a nightmare. Be prepared to spend more time looking for parking and paying for it than actually getting to the location. And they don't validate.  Finally arrived at the office and was given a list of questions the interviewers were going to ask me. (Not sure if that applies to all departments.)  Because of that, the interview went smoothly.
Interview Questions: What qualifies you for this position?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: You have to make it through a dual process application. You first will write about why you want the position and then you will either be invited or not to an in person interview. It can depend on how well you come off, such as being personal. You will really want to study up on the housing community you are applying for and what its values are and give personal responses to the questions.
Interview Questions: Please define diversity/ please give an example of a time you dealt with diversity.

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the Alumni Center about the internship. I received an email to schedule a phone call. After a brief phone call interview, an in-person interview was scheduled which lasted around 25-30 minutes.
Interview Questions: The interview process mainly focused on my interpersonal skills and reviewing my course load for the duration of the internship.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process depends on the department. I have had interviews with 3 different departments and all of them were different. 
One had a panel of 6 interviewers and it was a pretty difficult hour-long interview.
One had a panel of 2 interviewers that was too easy.
One was a pretty casual interview that was pretty easy as well.
Interview Questions: How do you keep yourself organized?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Received a call to schedule a time for the interview. For a work study position, it was like any other interview. I was interviewed by the lab that I wanted to join. My interviewer and I sat in a quiet area and she printed out my resume and asked me behavioral/personal questions. Never asked about anything on my resume, but I had to take a basic chemistry quiz (dilutions only).
Interview Questions: What are 3 things that describe you?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Presentation of your PhD work and any manuscripts submitted for publication as well as technical know hows in that particular field.  Questions on collaborations done with other labs as what took place and results of those collaborations.
Interview Questions: Technical Question

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application and was contacted within 1 month for an initial group phone call.  Contacted 2 weeks later for a panel interview.  One panelist walked in late to the interview, seemed like a red flag.
Interview Questions: how would you know that a student has learned something

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Application was first submitted online for review. Once accepted, I was given an offer to come and interview with selected faculty who were interested in me. During these meetings we discussed future research plans and fit with respective labs. I was also introduced to other graduate students in the department and taken on a tour with them and later to a dinner. It seemed as if the graduate students were also part of the interview process as they asked a lot of questions about my own work and how it would fit into their respective labs.
Interview Questions: Describe in detail a study you would like to run when you start in the Fall.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: phone screening followed by panel interview with HR, department head, hiring manager, and instructors.  Excellent communication throughout the entire process.  Panel had questions prepared in advance, a mix of technical and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How would you teach concept X to a student

title: Summer Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It started by contacting professors and talking about the available projects. Then, a short interview was conducted that was merely like a chat just to get to know each other.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do research?

title: Photographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was straight to the point and helpful. The interviewer told me exactly what he was looking for and did not waste my time or his time. I appreciated his honesty and the interview went very well overall.
Interview Questions: Do you have a portfolio?

title: Photographer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Went through a panel interview that lasted about an hour long. I met with the director, supervisor, and a colleague in the same role I applied for.  I was greeted and asked to sit in a group with the 3 interviewers. I was asked about basic understanding of camera functionality and editing software. I was also asked to provide a portfolio going over my best and worst photos, explaining what I liked about each and where I could have improved.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Video Production Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from the manager asking to see my interest in the position. Went in for an interview. Later got a call from the manager saying they wanted to move forward and later went in to meet HR.
Interview Questions: What kind of video productions did I have experience with?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied through recruiter. I interviewed at UC Irvine in May 2016. Phone screen and one hour in person interview. Interview level was average.  There was a panel of three members.  Technical questions were basics.
Interview Questions: Calculate a^b  that is super power of number.

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: A couple of questions about work ethic and asked about how much of a school load you have.  I was a student worker so they had to make sure that I had enough credits and time to work.
Interview Questions: How many classes are you taking this quarter?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and the process took about 2 weeks. The person was friendly and it was very one on one. Once I started I loved it and wish I could have stayed there longer
Interview Questions: How do I work individually and as a group?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: One on one in-person interview. The interviewer was in relaxed clothes and spoke candidly about expectations for the job. It was a fairly long conversation (roughly half an hour). The interviewer was never outwardly rude, but was fairly cold throughout.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about euthanizing animals?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The process was intense, but the people were amazing. There was a good mix of younger and older professionals and they seemed to value diversity. I had a phone screening with multiple people followed by an in person interview with the director.
Interview Questions: why I wanted to work on a college campus

title: Information Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Communication was good before and after the interview, however the interview was via a website called interviewstream, where you read a question, then record a video answer. You get three tries (which is good), but it makes the interview pointless for the interviewee because there's no way to ask them questions, gauge responses etc.
Interview Questions: Describe an accomplishment related to this position.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted about 1 hour, beginning with an casual chat about things I have done and what I want to accomplish. Then more details into what I did in terms of research projects. Exchanged ideas about what I can do to move the project forward. Overall, very general questions and did not involve specific technical details.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do for your future career.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I sent an email to the hiring manager and said I was interested in the position and attached my resume along wit the email. She was quick to respond and set up an interview time with me. The interview was a very quick interview! Basically was told of job requirements and expectations and asked to tell them about myself.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous work experiences

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Starts with 1:1 phone screen with mostly general tech questions that took about 1h, followed by panel tech interview with whiteboard exercises a week later that was also about 1h, then finally general "fit" panel interview for 1h.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize projects?

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Orange, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very casual! There were three pages of interview questions that come based off of your application and survey, so it will change for everyone. I was just with the nurse manager so I felt very at ease and able to answer as myself without the pressure of multiple people watching me.
Interview Questions: This is by far the most common interview question I have gotten as a new grad, name a time your patients status changed rapidly and what did you do?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: No interview.  Sign up for preferred TA courses and get assigned about a week before courses begin.  TA position is apart of graduate stipend.  There is no in person interview when you recieve funding through graduate school.
Interview Questions: Fill out survey online only.

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: - Email conversation after resume submission. My previous advisor had connection to the new advisor, although I did not know that during initial contact - Skype conversation with main advisor - In person presentation and full day of meetings. Officially offered position at the end of the final interview day.
Interview Questions: Very detailed questions about my study system.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite simple. It was more of signing paperwork than an interview. This could have been because the position was not competitive at all. After a 6 moths, the salary was renegotiated from ten dollars an hour, to fifteen dollars an hour.
Interview Questions: Any previous experience?

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: First I submitted an application in person at the UCI job fair. Then phone interview before being invited to group interview. The group interview consisted of about 20 applicants and 3 interviewers. Fun, out of the box questions
Interview Questions: Sell an object that was given to you (water bottle, pen, etc...)

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was about an hour long and I was asked about myself and what work experiences I have and what programming languages I was comfortable with. Then had a little technical question to do on the computer.
Interview Questions: Do this simple query in SQL.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Talked to three different people. The research coordinator, the physician, the psychologist. It was all one on one. It was a casual interview. They were professional and punctual. Asked questions and tried to get to know me.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself. What is your availability like? Why do you like research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Received a letter of acceptance to the program relatively late in the recruiting season, but was able to attend a recruiting weekend. Met with professors and graduate students throughout the day, and everyone was very friendly. Also had a fun excursion to a bar at night with a few grad students, although in recent years this part of the recruiting weekend has been cut out in favor of on-campus parties.
Interview Questions: Professors did not push too hard to recruit, which I liked.

title: Pavilion Greeter Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Started with informational session, followed by quick interviews to determine capabilities for positions.  All recruiters were energetic, enthusiastic and informative.  It was a very positive experience that made me feel good to be offered a position.
Interview Questions: What 2 positions I would like most to have.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, friendly supervisor. Asked basic questions about you, what do you choose this position. Walked you through the job's descriptions and told you what to be expected if you want to work here
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: I Was A Contract Student Affairs Specialist During Summer Session Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are conducted by several hiring managers. Generic questions about previous work experience and punctuality. Really relied on detailed orientated staff members. Asked about what makes you stand out from other candidates.
Interview Questions: How did you handle an unsatisfied guest?

title: Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was at least 30 minutes. The interview consist of mostly behavioral Questions with general technical questions regarding OS of my current computer. To summarize, the interview mostly looked for good workable people.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite web browser?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume to the professor and because of my background I was recommended to apply for admission. The professor also interviewed me and it came out very impressive to be a match for the lab. I applied and got the admission.
Interview Questions: I was asked by the professor that how good I am in managing multiple projects at a time and meeting deadlines.

title: Instructor (Big Data) Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with a member of UCI's Extension team over the phone. He was friendly and professional. He mentioned the fee that UCI pays its Big Data instructors, which was significantly below market rate - compared to what a Big Data vendor would pay a contract instructor.  Not only that, but the UCI course is longer in length and requires much more effort than the average vendor Big Data course. The whole conversation seemed pretty unrealistic, to be honest.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Talked to professor. Met him at his lab, met grad students, and he taught me how to use all the required equipment. He asked about my schedule and availability over summer for paid research as well.
Interview Questions: What my class schedule was.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I described my area of interest in research to my Professor and asked if a position for Research assistant was available, I had also forwarded my Resume. 
He asked me to meet him and discuss it in detail and after a small discussion I was asked about my availability over the summer, since he already knew that I got a good grade in the corresponding area of interest he offered me the position. 
I was also asked to work on some unfinished projects left by prevous members.
Interview Questions: Are you Available over the summer?

title: Assistant Director of Research Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: No Process. The individual responsible with hiring has no clue of the process (not qualified for the position to be a manager/director). The department is full of close minded individuals that don't respect the interviewee. Full of hypocrites that are clueless to their own position.
Interview Questions: During the 1:1 session, the first question received was, 'are you a cat or dog person?' (from an individual that has an equivalent position).

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the school's job/employment opportunities website. Standard application procedures. Then received a call and follow up email to schedule an interview.. After interviewing,  job was offered 3 days later. Accepted and had to fill out forms etc.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths/weaknesses? Why do you want to work here? What's your availability?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was not too difficult. They asked a lot of basic questions like what your job experience was and what the qualifications were for the occupation. They're really friendly people and the interview process went very smoothly.
Interview Questions: How organized are you?

title: Composition Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Granted the position as a graduate student. There isn't much else to say because I didn't have a formal interview until after I'd already been working there for three years. This was just a formality.
Interview Questions: Asked about previous teaching experience.

title: Administrative Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email for a phone interview a few days later. I spoke with the hiring manager for the phone screening, and the office was very accommodating to my schedule. I was offered an interview and was able to conduct it on a weekend. I met with the rest of staff later that week in another round of interviews, one was 2:1 and the other was 1:1.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Senior Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Large interview panel of approx 8 ppl--did not know about the panel until I walked into the room. MS PowerPoint presentation by me, as requested by hiring manager prior to accepting and scheduling the interview. Ended with a series of questions asked by each member of the panel.
Interview Questions: How do feel about presenting in front of a large crowd, possibly as big as over 200 people?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds of interaction with a professor that will try to determine if you are the right fit by asking a range of questions related to your field. Hard to say exactly what the process is because it will vary a lot depending on the department and the professor.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work here?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Written application including personal statement, research experience, resume, etc. The interview process includes one on one discussion of chemistry with professors in the department. Professors assess your knowledge of chemistry through discussion of their own research programs and your prior research experience.
Interview Questions: What is your most important scientific contribution?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Sit down with a manager. Discuss hours you're free to work. Get hired. Really not much more difficult besides the tedious paper application that they never read other than to see your available hours
Interview Questions: When can you come in

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: very friendly and nice talk. interviewer was not mean or rude at all. very friendly and comfortable. They was very able to know what skill sets i have and how this contribute to their research
Interview Questions: why you think that you are qualified with this job

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief a series of questions written on paper for me to see and then we went over my availability as well as why I would want to work at the job.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years and how will this job help you achieve that goal.

title: Activities GA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Fair and great experience, the interviewer made an easy going environment and also answered her own questions in her own way first. Group interviews are a lot less stressful and takes some of the load off of your shoulders.
Interview Questions: Questions were all customer service based.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The job interview process can be lengthy. Being interviewed once and getting a job offer is typically a thing of the past. Today, many companies have an involved interview process starting with screening interviews, followed by in-person interviews, second interviews and even third interviews
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Three person panel interview, was nervous but it went well.  Was offered the job, happily accepted it. Unfortunately the offer was rescinded, illegally according to my attorney, but what can I do?  Don't have the time or funds to legally challenge that, will just move on.
Interview Questions: Give example of what you did not like about your last position.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Usually be tested by the Professor who teaches the class on the class material. You also need to get an A in the same class when you took it. You usually need to apply through the engineering office, then you will need to send your resume to the Professor. He will review it and if he feels like you are a good fit, he will ask you in for an interview.
Interview Questions: Describe how OP-AMP works

title: Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Talk and interview. Met with  most of the faculty. It is a typical interview process for a faculty position. I met with faculty who had common interests with me which I thought was very positive. The whole process was very friendly.
Interview Questions: What do I plan to do in 5 years?

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interviews seem to be the norm.  I was interviewed by 5 people simultaneously.  They called it popcorn style and questions were directed at me from all members of the panel in a somewhat random order.  After advancing to the next round, I was asked to answer a case and submit my input in writing, rather than a presentation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Applied via their website and was called rather quickly. Set up an interview with the Director of the program that week. Immediately after finishing the interview with the Director, I was taken to the neighboring coworker's office and sat for another interview with her. I was also walked around the office being introduced to others. I believe this is so that everyone can get a feel for your fit, even if they aren't directly interviewing you. A few days later, I was invited back for a third and final interview with the most senior colleague which ending up being very casual and conversational. It was definitely the easiest interview of the the three.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals

title: Student Affairs Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: It was an interesting process. It depends on which department you are interviews for, but most of the questions were to fit and experience questions. The office environment seemed very upbeat and everyone seemed to genuinely be good colleagues .
Interview Questions: What was my favorite color and how it relates to the person I am.

title: Graphic Design Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief interview at a campus job fair where I just turned in an application and was asked a few general questions about my skills and experience. This got me to the next interview in an office with the hiring manager. The second interview took around 10 minutes, but was also straightforward and simple.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience using the Adobe design products?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was first interview on the phone by the director of HR and the Dean Associate. I was then selected for an in-person interview with the search committee and was invited to come back to do a second round and meet my team. Excellent process!
Interview Questions: It was a list of preset questions that opened up to a dialogue about the position.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Get into PhD program. Have experience either in academics and industry. Show you can think on your own. PhD students get first dibs to be a TA. They are required 2 quarters of TAship to get a PhD in the computer science school. Submit online availability form. You can pick which courses you would like to TA for. They will get back to you with an offer.
Interview Questions: I did not have an interview besides the online application.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied via Zotlink and got a call a few weeks later. I met with HR and the senior financial analyst. The interview was fun and relaxing, mainly discussing any experiences and volunteerism I had and not much was stated about the position directly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your resume.

title: Administrative Specialist, Planning and Budget Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, followed by a panel interview with three members. The last interview was with the Vice Provost that was more casual in nature. The questions were very easy and everyone was extremely nice during the process. During my last visit, I was shown around the office and introduced to some of the staff members.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with budgets?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very simple and straightforward. They just asked how I would teach the course I was applying to teach and I told them and they wanted lots of past references to talk to about my teaching experience. I had to give examples of my teaching methodology and samples of past courses taught with samples of materials and past student evaluations. It was not hard it was just tedious. Good luck!
Interview Questions: Give me examples of how you will teach your material.

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: In order to be considered for an interview a resume must be submitted to the professor. If the professor likes your resume be ready to answer questions about the projects/experience you have had before. During the interview the professor measures up your personality and how you react under pressure with different types of questions. Also, specific questions can be asked about anything you put on your resume.
Interview Questions: He asked questions about the Projects I worked on. Also, asked question about my work ethic.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: The LARC office sends out an email to all students with GPAs above 3.25 who also did exceptionally well in specific subjects. The student then has a certain amount of time to fill out an application, which includes his/her unofficial transcript and two faculty recommendations. Turn in the application as soon as possible, especially if your GPA is closer to 3.25, because a big part of the decision to invite the applicant for an interview comes from the early submission time of your application. The interview is a group interview, with about 2-3 other applicants and is pretty relaxed. My interviewer emphasized relaxation and no judgement throughout the interview. They ask questions ranging from what do you think are three characteristics a great tutor should have to would you be open to hang out with other tutors and attend LARC socials? They care about providing a sense of community and understanding in the LARC program because that's really how a tutor should be with his/her students.
Interview Questions: What is one random fact about you as a child?

title: Full-time ESL Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: There is a two-step process. The first are the usual employment experience questions, how many years and what skills have you taught, classroom management scenarios, etc. They second stage is a teaching demonstration. You are given a topic (thing of difficult grammar points especially), and given some time to prepare. Then the interviewing panelists will act as your students. Be prepared for them to throw questions and perhaps behavior issues at you.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: OpenCourseWare Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very brief and was consistently focused on my abilities rather than my work experience. I patiently stood outside of the office doors as I waited to called to the interview room. Once called, I was greeted by two directors: one from the department I was applying for, and one from Human Resources. I was not in the best shape to provide a strong interview, but the interviewers continued to make me feel at ease by smiling and sustaining a gentle tone. They ask me specifically if I can fulfill my duties within specific situations and context; which gave me a clearer ideas of how the workflow will be.
Interview Questions: Q: How did you learn or train to acquire [specific skill]?

title: Tutorial Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Intensive interview process.  Ensures the candidates are well prepared for the rigors of the job.  Staff are welcoming and do not shun you from any response.  Great interview for the job
Interview Questions: Please lead a mock tutorial session.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Standard Graduate School Application
Interview Questions: Standard Application Process. Rather opaque, but that's standard.

title: Grad Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview with potential research advisors about your research objectives and goals, process pipe line and subjects of interest. Very flexible and understanding environment, they want you to succeed.
Interview Questions: Why this program and why this subject

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: They asked me pretty basic questions. Most of the time they were just talking about the position and what it entails. It's an easy interview to be honest. Just be yourself, they just want someone who is reliable and trustworthy enough to handle their admin work. Just smile and be positive!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Once you are asked for an intake you will take a few tests on the computer to test typing speed, excel, and word proficiencies. Then you will review your experiences and what you are looking for on campus. There are different levels of employment and the pay scale reflects this.
Interview Questions: Test Microsoft Word and Excel knowledge.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview. Submit your application materials and in most cases you will have no interview.  If there is something special about you, and they really want you, there might be an interview.  There is almost no care about any exams or tests if you are worried about that.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Executive Director of Center for Autism Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The initial call was a phone interview to debrief me about the job description, discuss the details of this job description and salary and benefits it offers. A more in depth interview with a committee will take place late March. There will be more opportunities to learn about this role and ask questions then.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Phd Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvin Cobb Resort, KY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I first emailed one of the professors I found related to my interests. Then he replied me that he wants to take a new student this year. So I applied and after that I was interviewed with him.
Interview Questions: Some general questions like why you chose UCI? Why this field? ... He also asked me a bit about my previos projects but not any technical interviw questions

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Walk into the place long waddup I got an interview. Wait for a sweaty manager to come sit down with you to ask what times you're able to come in & if overyime is an option
Interview Questions: behavioral

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was straight-forward and not intimidating. Questions were job-related so if you understand what the job is about you will be fine. Mostly common sense questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Reader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The professor just ask me some basic knowledge of C programming.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview since I have been a teaching assistant for a couple of years and had established myself as a successful TA.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Direct contact with faculty.
Interview Questions: Research plan.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the recruiter who asked a series of questions.  I was advised that it was fairly likely I would be getting a call back based on my positive feedback & answers. I received a call the following day - interviewed with the supervisor in person.  Was called back for the final panel interview with the Vice Chancellor and 3 of his staff.  Nailed the interview & started working in Jan upon returning from vacation.
Interview Questions: To describe one of the most difficult situations in the workplace that I've felt I overcame.  How did I go about the process, what did I do to succeed and what would I do differently next time.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
The interview consisted of meeting every person in the lab for approximately 20 minutes.  I met with the PI for 1 hour in the morning and was shuffled between people.  I went to lunch with the lab members and at the end of the day gave a 1 hour talk on my scientific background and recent publication.  

The hiring process was fairly simple.  I heard it varies from department to department.  The Department of Anatomy was helpful.  You should follow up if you haven't heard about parts of your paperwork in a few days.  There are lots of post-doctoral researchers, and sometimes they forget.
Interview Questions: What specific aims would you propose based on the findings of your last publication.

title: Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Need to present strong case presentation. Meet with management and other staff. Questions on clinical skills, interpersonal skills, commitment to diversity issues. Interview process is very important to determine fit to staff and job position.
Interview Questions: Question about clinical case

title: Staff Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very strong background in Molecular and Cell Biology, but no stem cell experiences
Interview Questions: animal experiments and stem cell experiments

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very friendly and open. She made sure I was comfortable and would stop to make sure I understood the requirements of the job. After going over the requirements, she asked me about my availability as well as a schedule of my classes so that we could find a consistent time where I would be able to work. It was very school-friendly and open to new students looking for work experience and money to help them pay for school, food, or rent.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in administrative work?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine
Interview Descriptions: Letter, grades and interview based interview process
Interview Questions: Major research interests in details

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, contacted within 2 weeks. Went to two interviews.  The first was an skills and experience evaluation, and the second was an evaluation for fit. Both interviews took a little more than and hour each.
Interview Questions: How do you get tasks done when standard procedures give conflicting steps.

title: Finance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the school career center's website. The process took about one week. I got an interview with four full-time staffs, including the HR Analyst. They basically asked behavioral questions and went over your resume. They only asked if you know about Excel but did not test your skills. It was an easy interview. I was called one or two days later and received an offer.
Interview Questions: Easy. Just Behavior questions. Ask if you know Excel.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: A phone call was conducted to determine an interview appointment. This led to a face to face interview where the director (hiring manager) walked you through the various roles and responsibilities related to the job. The interview mostly consisted of questions that assessed your competency and ability to manage several tasks at once as well as familiarity with certain processes and tools. It was a one round interview.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Housing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (UCI, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a bit intimidating as there were 3-4 people interviewing you at the same time. They asked some outside the box questions such as if you had a super power, what would it be?
Interview Questions: If you had a super power, what would you pick and why?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Relatively painless and short, just some personal questions and some detail about past work experience. In the end you just walk on site for the interview and then afterwords if they liked you or thought you'd be reliable they let you know that you had an offer. I'm not quite sure how it works if you got rejected though.
Interview Questions: How would you act in front of a troubled customer?

title: Division of Dean of Students Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring committee consisted of approximately 8-10  mid-to-senior level employees. There was an agenda that was followed for consistency. Employee introduction to committee members followed by a round-table format of standardized questions approximately 2 per member. Questions closely adhered to job description, job priorities, job stability with only a few left field questions that could not be prepared in advance. Candidates that advanced were also expected to form a mock 5 minute presentation on a scenario.
Interview Questions: Left field questions: How/What would you do if (blank) crisis developed and there was no protocol in place?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied through a referral from a friend. Had an interview with one of the managers there, was offered the job. Everyone was very friendly yet professional, and the overall process was very quick. The questions were all very standard and to the point.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you're a good fit for this position?

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Had a series of three interviews.  Two in person and one phone interview. Thorough background check and reference check.  The process moved very quickly (less than 7 days from initial phone interview). References were checked same day of in person interview.
Interview Questions: Very technical questions around replication and clustering.

title: Crew Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process, asked questions about balancing time work school. Questions about own's weaknesses and strengths. Once hired, get a time card, get the Bren apparel and ID Card. Work hours are flexible. The older members teach the new members how to do things.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness is always the hardest question because there are so many. Second would be what is your strength since it is very subjective. Both questions can be easily answered but a lot of thought is put into it afterwards, reflecting upon your answers can make you a better person.

title: Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, met with two senior staff who asked about basic programming and scripting techniques. Laid back and made sure everything was comfortable. Started off with basic personality questions and team fit. Then went to the server rooms and had an interview there with more technical questions. Finally was given 20 minutes to write a script.
Interview Questions: How would you create a script to run every night across every server to perform XXX task?

title: Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. Was panel based, expect 2-3 members of the upper management to interview you. Bring your resume, they will ask about basic IT related topics such as getting rid of viruses, fixing screens, and more. Discussed pay and hours.
Interview Questions: How would go about replacing a Logic Board on a MacBook Pro?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: You need to pass an english test if you are an international student. The test has 4 sections. They give you 15 minutes to get ready yourself with some material they will give you. You must explain a graph and be ready to answer questions about it, then, you need to explain a couple of terms from your area of expertise, then you need to give a mini class of 4 minutes and at some point there will be an interview where they will ask about you, just to see if you can understand english
Interview Questions: What did you do this summer?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview took place on campus in the school of social ecology building. Interviewer was interested in knowing whether I work in a micro or macro managed environment and how I work with others. I was accepted an offer within the next two days.
Interview Questions: Do you prefer to work in a micro managed or macro managed environment?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I sent my academic resume to UCI through a funding agency. They liked the resume and called me for an interview.
Interview Questions: General question about my research interests and future plans.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Prospective interviewees would submit their resume online. Approximately two to three weeks later, administration would call the students and schedule a panel interview lasting around 30-45 minutes long. In about one week, administration would call potential applicants for a second round of interviews. The final applicants would be hired.
Interview Questions: How would the student direct somebody who had trouble locating a particular building on campus? Many applicants are in their first year of college and don't know much about the geography.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: First interview was one-to-one interview with the department manager.  Second interview involved more staffs at the same time, dept manager, school head, and other supervisory level staffs.  Interview does not contain any practical test on computer, no personality test, nor IQ test is required.  However, it requested for your working authorization documents.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply for this position?  What make you think you are best suitable for this position?

title: Biomedical Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: First, the applications were reviewed and the candidates were narrowed down to a few. The few that were chosen were then able to have two phone interviews to determine their eligibility. Very professional and intellectual.
Interview Questions: What classes have you taken and how do you think they will affect your performance?

title: Sports Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I sent in a cover letter and resume. They got back to me and I had a group interview with 2 other people. It was a relatively smooth group interview, everyone a fair opportunity to answer the questions. After that interview, they called me back for another interview, but it was essentially to say that I had gotten the internship
Interview Questions: What are the things that motivate you to work?

title: General Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through UC Irvine's career website (ZotLink) with just a resume. They called me to schedule an interview, which consisted of a panel. The panel took turns asking questions and all seemed engaged and knowledgeable. I received an offer via phone call about a few days later with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Past challenges and how one overcame them.

title: Projektleiter / Verkäufer international Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted through email, asking which days I was available for coming in for an interview. During the interview, I was tested for skills, mainly about Java and inheritance. Then afterwards, he asked me if I was to design a media library program, how would I do it?  Using paper, I drawn out the UI and abstract objects that most likely were needed in such a program.
Interview Questions: How would you design a media library program?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then went and spoke to the manager and asked them to interview me.  There were 300 applicants for the job, so I became a volunteer.  After volunteering for 6 weeks, I had an interview.
Interview Questions: How many children do you have

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The process involved me submitting my resume and application through the UC Irvine job postings web site. That in itself was a cumbersome process, as I was required to enter information about my relevant work experience and education that was on my resume. I received a phone call from the HR department to schedule a phone interview about a month after I submitted my application.

The interview was a conference call, with two people from UC Irvine. The phone call lasted about 45 minutes, and the two people alternated in asking me questions about my previous experience.

After the first interview, I received an email about two weeks later that I was not going to be offered the position.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions asked in the interview. The one that was required the most extensive and comprehensive answer was "describe the most marketing campaign that you developed, and what were the factors for its success."

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Job talk for 1 hour and 30 minutes, individual 30 minute interviews with faculty discussing research, interview with dept chair discussing benefits, teaching, dinner and lunch with faculty during which we socialized but also discussed research. The department was extremely welcoming.
Interview Questions: What is your future research direction

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Two professors scheduled a phone interview and asked me questions about my goals. They did not ask much about my background or about the papers I have published. The interview lasted around 30 minutes. I asked one or two questions about what they believe was necessary to be successful in a Ph.D. program. One professor said that creative students fair better. The other just said that it requires a lot of reading. I asked about the average duration of the program, for which they said about 6 years, but I heard that many students take 7 and a few cases almost 10(!).
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to go to graduate school?
What are your research interests?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
After applying for this position online, I received an email two days later asking for a phone interview with the hiring manager.  Of course, I accepted, and the interview was schedule later in the week.  The phone interview was about an hour, and it felt like a real genuine conversation between the hiring manager and myself.  Some of the interview questions consisted of student development, program planning, and interest in the position.  During the wrap up of the phone interview, he invited to come to campus for a visit and to meet his supervisor and colleagues.  The following week, I met with him and his supervisor and colleagues during a two hour period.  I was asked everything from my experiences working with students, student development, customer service, etc.

Some sound advice I would give is to ensure that you know the audience.  Although it was a student affairs position, the department works closely with the admissions staff.  They were included in the interview process and handled their portion of the interview much differently than the student affairs side.  Nevertheless, everyone seemed to be dedicated to their jobs, their work for the students, and the program itself.  Although I didn't receive an offer for the position, I could definitely sense that this team was really genuine, especially the hiring manger.  He gave me some sound advice and feedback, which was greatly appreciated.
Interview Questions: Student Development, Program Planning, Customer Service, Event Planning, Experience Advising Students

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very informal and easy to speak to Advisor.  Great mentor and listener.

title: Student Affairs Officer Interview

title: Lab Facilitator Interview

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview

Interview Descriptions: Your academic scores and prior research experience is key to getting an interview.
