Demonstrating a desire to go into anything other than academia will cost you an admission.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Feb 2011

title: Graduate Student Interview

title: Programmer/Analyst II Interview

title: Computing Support Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the school's job website, and received an email to schedule an interview. This was a position for current students, so they were very kind to work around my schedule. The interview was with both supervisors present. Questions mostly were about my technical background and my problem solving skills, specifically with troubleshooting IT problems and my understanding of the current infrastructure. They were up-front about it being OK to not know everything, and explained they were more than willing to teach someone they thought was capable. Towards the end, they asked a few personality questions, just to make sure I was a good fit.
Interview Questions: Do your friends and family regularly come to you for help troubleshooting IT issues?

title: Operations Crew Member Interview

title: Personnel Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: (I was already a UC Irvine employee, just looking to change departments for growth opportunity.)  Learned about the position directly from the hiring manager, who I met through a campus-wide training event.  Had an in-person interview later with the hiring manager and a higher-up who would have a working relationship with the hired candidate.  Questions focused on knowledge of personnel policies.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the merit review process?

title: Student Programming Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Since I sent my resume and cover letter directly to the hiring manager, my first contact with the University was with him. He was very friendly and accommodating as he tried to schedule an interview time.

The interview was held outside with just him. Although he had a set of questions printed out on what looked like a standardized form, he pushed a bit so don't expect a generic interview. He had intelligent questions.

Afterwards, he made a verbal offer.

Unfortunately, he later found that his boss wanted to interview me. It was very difficult to schedule that one and so, though the first interview was in May, the next one was in June. When we finally met, she was friendly though the interview was very brief; it took less than half an hour.

The office was clean but the work areas are cramped. The student programming offices are shared with each office holding 2 to 3 people.
Interview Questions: What do you do when you get up in the morning?

title: Technical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Simply applied online through zotlink, then I was contacted via email for an interview. It was 1 on 1 with some technical questions. The questions include Javascript, basic computer knowledge, and web designing. The interviewer was very professional.
Interview Questions: read javascript

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Jan 2009

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Director, MBA Career Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions:
Called exec director, gave elevator speech, invited in for first interview.  Had 2nd interview with soon to be colleagues, then third interview was presentation.  First interview, just listened to exec director go on and on and on about his philosophy - kinda zoned out b/c he just kept going.  Second interview - talked to a potential colleague - really didn't care for her, but liked position so continued (should have gone with gut on this one) - not very probing in questions - not much of an interviewer.  Final interview met rest of team - they asked a couple of   "what if" questions - again not taxing and I presented for them.  Presentation was fun and they liked it.  
Biggest caution to potential candidates is current regime - just be careful b/c more than any place I've ever been, one on the team definitely favors certain members.  On the good side though, leadership is pretty old and won't be there much longer so you may want to wait until a new group takes over before you apply.
Interview Questions: You must perform a 20 minute presentation on the field of marketing and where the opportunities are for MBA students

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC Irvine (Irvine, CA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two library assistants.
